case_circumstances: On July 5, 2013 the United States Border Patrol were performing a routine aerial helicopter patrol when they observed what appeared to be multiple human bodies in a remote desert area on the Barry Goldwater Gunnery Range. Border Patrol notified the Maricopa County sheriff' office at which time deputies were dispatched to the scene located at North 32° 31.558 W. 113° 07.653 where the deaths of three unidentified males was pronounced at 1320, hours.
case_clothing_on_body: The subject's body was clothed in a pair of Wrangler brand blue jeans (relaxed fit) size 32X 32 which had a brown leather belt with a white metal buckle looped through the belt loops.A pair of jockey style CTY&CO brand underwear, and  three white socks.
case_clothing_with_body: A size medium "Inter Moda" white tank top
case_footwear: A pair of brown colored makeshift shoes with bailing twine laces. A pair of "Flexi Country" boots (size unknown) and one gray sock
case_other_items_with_body: The subject had in his possession a cell phone and two prayer cards one of which portrayed as Juan Diego and the other which portrayed Our Lady of Guadalupe
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
